channel.title: Mailund on the Internet
channel.description: Recent content on Mailund on the Internet

item.title: Slides (CT Chapter 7)
item.description: There is not a whole lot to say about recursion as such, but I’ve made a few slides. Half of it is just about how function calls work.

item.title: Exercises (CT chapter 5)
item.description: I’m on a roll today! Here are the exercises for chapter 5 of Introduction to Computational Thinking. Let me know if you spot any errors; I am known to make some from time to time.

item.title: Exercises (CT chapter 4)
item.description: I think I’m done with the exercises for chapter 4 of Introduction to Computational Thinking. Which is good, because I need to put them on Blackboard for my students this week.

item.title: Overscoping and eval
item.description: In my previous post I used the lm function for an example of scope rules, but I left a few details out.

item.title: Slides for Computational Thinking (Chapter 5)
item.description: I just finished make slides for chapter 5 of Introduction to Computational Thinking that covers search and sorting algorithms. The slides cover linear and binary search, insertion, selection and bubble sort, as well as bucket and radix sort.

item.title: Scoping Rules and NSE
item.description: Earlier this week, I wrote some tweets about how you have to be careful about scopes when you do “non-standard evaluation”.

item.title: Slides (CT chapters 3 and 4)
item.description: I played around a little with my slides for chapter three of Introduction to Computational Thinking and made slides for chapter four.

item.title: Exercises (CT chapter 3)
item.description: I have cleaned up the exercises for chapter three of Introduction to Computational Thinking. I’m still not exactly sure how best to provide them to my students, or if I can figure out some way to automatically test answers so they can be more interactive, but I have listed them below.

item.title: Complexity Exercises
item.description: In the second lesson that I teach in our Computational Thinking in Bioinformatics I cover algorithmic complexity. It is chapter four in my (draft) book on the topic: Introduction to Computational Thinking.

item.title: Slides for Computational Thinking (Chapter 3)
item.description: I’m teaching four weeks of a class called Computational Thinking in Bioinformatics this year (the other weeks are taught by colleagues).

item.title: The Coming Storm
item.description: If you are a member of Audible—and if you like audiobooks I think you should be—then they now give you two of six selected books for free every month.

item.title: Premarkdown Plugins
item.description: I’m working on a preprocessor for Markdown documents. I write all my books in Markdown, so this is something I have wanted to do for a while, to scratch a few itches I have.

item.title: Fluent Python
item.description: I just finished reading Fluent Python. This is a really nice book on Python programming. It is not an introduction to Python programming, and it is not about specific packages, such as SciPy or Scikit-learn.

item.title: New Books Page
item.description: I have set up a page for the books I have written. Nothing fancy there, it is just a list together with the cover text, but it does collect all my books on one single page.

item.title: New Blog
item.description: Ok, so, I have had a lot of problems with keeping Wordpress and various plugins up to date on my old mailund.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there, This is my personal blog and shouldn’t be confused with my word-webpages. I speak only for myself here, even when I write about work-related things.

item.title: Books
item.description: I enjoy writing and I’ve written bunch of books by now. Mostly about R programming, but also on a few other topics.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Textbooks 2019 The Joys of Hashing: Hash Table Programming with C Thomas Mailund Apress, May 14, 2019, ISBN-10: 1484240650, ISBN-13: 978-1484240656 2018 Domain-Specific Languages in R: Advanced Statistical Programming Thomas Mailund Apress, June 23, 2018, ISBN-10: 1484240049, ISBN-13: 978-1484240045 2017 Functional Data Structures in R: Advanced Statistical Programming in R Thomas Mailund Apress, November 18, 2017, ISBN-10: 1484231430, ISBN-13: 978-1484231432

item.title: Software
item.description: I have written various software over the years. You can get a list of most of it at GitHub. Below is a list of software I have worked on recently (and I promise to still be maintaining).
